component.description: DataTable is an enhanced version of the standard Datatable that provides built-in solutions to many commons use cases like paging, sorting, selection, lazy loading, filtering and more.
component.attributes:
&data_component_attributes; &widget_var_attribute;
paginatorTemplate false java.lang.String Template of the paginator.
selectable false java.lang.String Can data in this table be selected? If so, display a form showing the results of the selection.
selectionForm false java.lang.String ID of the form used to display the selection.
selectAction false java.lang.String JavaScript function that downloads a JSON object representing the selection detail. Input is a row object from the data table.
condition false java.lang.String JavaScript expression that, if true, means the table should be rendered and, if false, means the table should be hidden.
dataList false java.lang.String JavaScript expression that evaluates to a list of objects, each of which corresponds to one row in the table.
deltaList false java.lang.String JavaScript object that, as an alternative to dataList, has three component lists: adds, updates, and deletes. These lists are used to update the database accordingly.
cols false java.lang.String false If the table should have more than 1 column, a comma-seperated list of column names.
columnRenderer true java.lang.String Java script expression that renders a single column of data. Parameters are row (the row data), rowidx (the row index), and colName (the column name).
emptyMessage false java.lang.String No records found. Text to display when there is no data to display. Default is "No records found."
style false java.lang.String Inline style of the main container.
styleClass false java.lang.String Style class of the main container.
tableStyle false java.lang.String Inline style of the table element.
tableStyleClass false java.lang.String Style class of the table element.
rowStyleClass false java.lang.String Style class for each row.
sortFields false java.lang.String false Object fields available for sorting. These fields must match to field names in the individual objects in the datalist property.
sortBy false java.lang.Object Object field to be used for default sorting.
sortOrder false java.lang.String ascending Sets sorting order. Default is "ascending"
rowKey false java.lang.String Name of the field to be used as the primary key of each object in the dataList. The default is the 'key' field.
